page.title: 01THE LEIGHTERTON AREA
page.content: Our block lies in the southern Cotswolds about 4 miles south of Nailsworth. Most of the block is in the county of Gloucestershire, but some of the western part is in the county of Avon. Nearly all the land is used for farming, especially arable farming. The A46 Stroud-Bath road runs through our block from north east to south west. There is a little woodland in the area, most of it in the south east corner where part of the Westonbirt Arboretum called the Silk Wood falls in our block. There are very few houses in the area. The only village is the small village of Leighterton.
